Description: Cast scarab in copper alloy; back and base plain; amuletic function; very corroded.
Curator's comments: Petrie signalled this find in his journal: 'Among the small things of this week I should note [...] a bronze scarab' (Petrie Journal 1884-5, p. 156). On amulets of scarabs in general see: Andrews 1994, 59; Herrmann et al. 2010, 120-121 (type 69). Andrews, C. 1994, Amulets of Ancient Egypt, London. Herrmann, C., Staubli, T., Berger-Lober, S., Keel, O., Schönbächler, G. 2010, 1001 Amulett : altägyptischer Zauber, monotheisierte Talismane, säkulare Magie, Bibel+Orient-Museum, Liebefeld, Stuttgart.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.251) (phase 3)
